data.title: Famous Film Actors From Kerala
data.meta_description: List of famous movie actors & actresses who were born in Kerala, listed alphabetically with photos when available. Some of these celebrities weren't ...
data.text:
Mohanlal Viswanathan, universally known as Mohanlal, is a seminal figure in Indian cinema. Born on May 21, 1960, in Kerala, India, he nurtured an early passion for acting that would quickly evolve into an illustrious career spanning over four decades. A versatile performer, Mohanlal has collaborated with filmmakers across different genres and generations, injecting his unique essence into each role. His cinematic journey began in 1980 when he made his debut in the Malayalam film Manjil Virinja Pookkal. Since then, Mohanlal has acted in more than 300 films, primarily in Malayalam, but also in other languages like Hindi, Tamil, and Telugu. His transformative performances have been consistently recognized at both national and international levels. He has received multiple National Film Awards in India, along with an honorary Padma Shri and Padma Bhushan from the government for his contributions to Indian cinema. More than just an actor, Mohanlal has also proven his mettle as a producer and playback singer, further demonstrating his multi-faceted talent. He was bestowed with the title of Lieutenant Colonel in the Territorial Army of India, becoming the first actor to be awarded such an honor. Yet, despite his many accomplishments, Mohanlal remains a humble and dedicated artist, revered by many but only truly known by few.

Jagathi Sreekumar, a renowned Indian actor, was born on January 5, 1951 in Kerala, India. He is best known for his work in the Malayalam cinema where he has showcased his exceptional talent in over 1,000 films, earning him various accolades and recognition. His journey in the world of acting began in 1974 with the film Kanyakumari and since then, there has been no looking back. His versatility as an actor has been displayed through different roles ranging from comedy to intense drama, making him a household name in the South Indian film industry. Sreekumar's dedication to his craft earned him two Kerala State Film Awards. These were for Best Actor in 1991 for his role in Mukha Chithram, and the second one came in 1995 as Special Jury Award for his role in Kerala Verma Pazhassi Raja. His distinct ability to capture the essence of every character he portrayed, combined with his unique style of dialogue delivery, made him a beloved figure among audiences across generations. Beyond his remarkable career in cinema, Sreekumar also left a significant mark in the television and theater industry. His roles in various TV serials and dramas added another dimension to his acting portfolio and further cemented his place as a versatile performer.

Ashish Vidyarthi, a name synonymous with versatility in the Indian film industry, was born on 19th June 1962 in Tellicherry, Kerala. He is known for his extensive body of work that spans across various languages and genres. Son of renowned Kathak dancer Reba Vidyarthi and veteran film actor Govind Vidyarthi, Ashish was inevitably drawn to the performing arts from a young age. He graduated from the National School of Drama, New Delhi, which honed his acting skills and prepared him for the diverse roles he would go on to portray. Despite making his acting debut in a minor role in the 1986 Bollywood film Anokha Rishta, it was his chilling portrayal of a ruthless gangster in the 1994 Kannada film Om that won him widespread recognition. This performance earned him the National Film Award for Best Supporting Actor, firmly establishing him as a compelling character actor. Since then, Ashish has appeared in over 200 films in languages including Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam, and Bengali, showcasing his linguistic dexterity and adaptability as an actor. Off-screen, Ashish Vidyarthi is not just an accomplished actor but also a motivational speaker and life coach. He founded 'Avid Miner', a platform through which he inspires individuals and organizations to discover their full potential. His ability to connect with people and influence them through his powerful speeches has made him a sought-after speaker at corporate events and educational institutions. Thus, Ashish Vidyarthi's journey reflects a man of many talents and a passion for both his craft and creating a positive impact in the lives of others.
